steps.title: Lighten up the conversation by sending a silly â€œthank youâ€ text.
steps.content: Lighten up the conversation by sending a silly â€œthank youâ€ text. If your friend, family member, or partner gets uncomfortable with praise, drop a funny one-liner to make them laugh and feel at ease. steps.title: Specify what youâ€™re thankful for and give a genuine compliment.
steps.content: Specify what youâ€™re thankful for and give a genuine compliment . According to etiquette coach Tami Claytor, â€œyou want to be as specific as possibleâ€ when thanking someone. Explaining why youâ€™re grateful is more sincere than a simple â€œthank youâ€ because it highlights the importance of someoneâ€™s words or actions. If you want to deepen your relationship, mention what you admire about the other person to make them feel special . [4] X Research source Iâ€™m forever indebted to you. Youâ€™re truly invaluable in my life. Iâ€™m eternally grateful for your support. I appreciate you more than youâ€™ll ever know. Iâ€™m touched by what you said about me. Thank you. Thank you for thinking of me. It truly means the world. Words canâ€™t describe how grateful I am to be your partner. Thank you for everything. Youâ€™ve been a blessing in my life. Thanks for standing up for me back there. I really needed it. Iâ€™m so honored to be your friend. Youâ€™re my biggest role model. Iâ€™ve been feeling a little down lately, so thank you for saying that. Thank you for always having my back. I hope I can repay you soon. Your kindness is truly inspiring. Thank you for being so patient with me. You bring so much joy into my lifeâ€”your positivity is truly heartwarming. Thanks for being there through the highs and lows. Youâ€™re a friend for life! Iâ€™m so lucky to know you. Thank you for supporting me during this difficult time. If you could read my mind, youâ€™d know how grateful I am for you at this moment. Youâ€™re one of the most genuine people Iâ€™ve ever met, so thank you for being you. You know me better than anyone else. Thank you for making me feel appreciated. Thanks for being honest, loyal, and supportiveâ€”youâ€™re the definition of a true friend. Friends like you are hard to find. Thank you for being here during the good and bad times. Thank you for sending me that blue sweater on my birthday. When I wear it to work, Iâ€™ll think of you. Iâ€™ll never forget the time you helped me after my breakup. Thank you for always being there for me.

steps.title: Tell your boss or colleague that their contributions make a big difference.
steps.content: Tell your boss or colleague that their contributions make a big difference. If someone helps you or gives you a compliment , let them know that their support is invaluable. This is a great strategy to build better relationships in the workplace, whether they offer you advice or tangible assistance on a project. [5] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source I sincerely appreciate your help. Iâ€™m thankful for your kind remarks. That means a lot coming from you. Thank you for going above and beyond. I feel so lucky to have you as a colleague. Iâ€™m flattered that you think so highly of me. I couldnâ€™t have done it without your support. I really appreciate your dedication to the company. Iâ€™m beyond grateful for your support on this project. I appreciate your honest feedback on the presentation. Youâ€™re done a phenomenal job. Keep up the hard work! Thank you. Youâ€™re too kind, and Iâ€™m glad weâ€™re on the same team! You have brilliant ideas. Thank you for sharing them at the meeting. Thank you for helping me on the assignment. How can I repay you? Thank you for being such an amazing leader. Iâ€™m truly inspired by you. I canâ€™t thank you enough for helping me during the onboarding process. Thank you for being so cheerful and optimistic. You make our team shine! Itâ€™s been a privilege to work with you. Thank you for being an incredible manager. Your kindness is unmatched. I can see why everyone wants to sit with you at lunch! I wanted to let you know that your hard work isnâ€™t going unnoticed. I see you, and I appreciate all your efforts.
